title: NDMA’s 21st aid shipment arrives in Syria
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 28 (APP):The 21st consignment of humanitarian aid, sent by the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) for war-affected and displaced people in Palestine, Gaza, and Lebanon, has successfully arrived in Damascus.
The chartered flight, carrying 17 tons of relief items arranged by NDMA, departed from Nur Khan Base last Wednesday.
Air Marshal (R) Shahid Akhtar, Pakistan’s Ambassador to Damascus, received the humanitarian aid.
The Government of Pakistan remains committed to supporting the war-affected people of Palestine (Gaza) and Lebanon with humanitarian assistance.
